page.title: 12LOCAL EVENTS-WEST NOTTINGHAM
page.content: {1981 Golden Jubilee }celebrations of{ {William Crane }schools.{Aspley }estate also {fifty }years old.{1982 } Britain's first {surrogate mother } from Broxtowe Lane.{1984/5 Miner's {strike:}Notts miners work.{1984 Jayne {Torvill}(from Basford) & {Christopher {Dean}drove thru' area on city tour as World Ice Dance Champions. Three garages burnt down. Distinctive new Co-op superstore opened on Strelley Road. Annual Autumn{Fun Fair}on Melbourne Park,Aspley. {Community {Policemen}project begun. {1985}Some local schools affected by {Teachers {strike. Prince Charles}and{Princess {Diana}passed thru' area during {Royal {Visit}to Nottingham. Spring {Fun Fair} (annual event) on Melbourne Park,Aspley. New 'bus service-{"Access {Line"}-introduced.
